resources.string: Take a photo in manual mode without the filter in an environment where the light doesn\'t change. Ideally there\'s no daylight and a constant artificial light source. Use a tripod to fix the camera.
Now put on the filter and compensate for it by cranking up the exposure time by the factor the filter manufacturer claims. Don\'t change ISO and aperture!
Take the photo and compare the histograms. They should look identical. If they don\'t, repeat step 2 with increased or decreased shutter speed until they do.
Pick a speed with filter ≥ speed without filter
